N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 21 ยง 1551.6 - Procedures prior to the preparation of draft EIS's

State Regulations
(a) Environmental review of proposed actions. The committee, upon issuing a negative declaration or notice of determination, shall immediately file such declaration or determination as follows: (1)
with the appropriate regional office of
the Department of Environmental Conservation; (2)
with the Commissioner of Environmental

Conservation; and
(3)
in the files
of SUCF and a copy to the subject SUNY campus. (b) Determination of no significant
effect--negative declaration. If the committee determines that the project will
not have a significant effect on the environment, it shall prepare, circulate, file and make available for public inspection a negative declaration with a
statement setting forth the reasons supporting its determination. (c) Determination of significant
effect--notice of determination. If the committee determines that the project
may have a significant effect on the environment, it shall immediately have
prepared and file a notice of determination as provided in subdivisions (a) and
(e) of this section. If the project involves other agencies, the committee
shall notify such other involved agencies, including Federal agencies, of its
determination, request the coordination of reviews by the agencies, and inform
them of the need to resolve which agency shall be the lead agency in accordance
with 6 NYCRR
617.6. (d) Non-lead
agency status. If SUCF is not the lead agency for a project that may have a
significant effect on the environment, it shall: (1)
provide its views where appropriate and, to the extent practical, provide appropriate technical analysis and support; and
(2)
make written findings
pursuant to 6 NYCRR
617.9. (e) Contents of negative declaration and
notices of determination. All negative declarations and notices of
determination shall contain the following: (1)
a project identifying number; (2)
a brief description of the
project; (3)
the location of the
project (county and city, town or village); (4)
in the case of a negative declaration, a
statement that the committee has determined that the project will not have a
significant effect on the environment; (5)
in the case of a notice of determination, a brief description of the possible significant effects of the project; and
(6)
the name and address of the
lead agency and the name and telephone number of an officer who can provide
further information. Notes
